name: Airborne
desc: A creature knocked into the air and unable to defend themselves.
effect: Attacks against an Airborne creature have _Advantage_ and gain [_Sure Hit_ 2]. Additionally, while Airborne, their _Elevation_ is increased by 1, but they do not gain any bonuses from this.
remove: Creature are Airborne until the end of the current _Phase_, they suffer _Forced Movement_, or they gain _Flight_. If the creature loses this _Restrained_ by either of the first two means they _Fall_, at the end of the _Forced Movement_ if applicable.

name: Overarmor
desc: Armor that, while powerful, is temporary easily stripped away.
effect: Overarmor will always specify a _Durability_, a _Guard_ value, as well as any _Resistances_. While a creature has Overarmor, increase their _Guard_ by the listed value, and they gain the _Resistances_ of their Overarmor.
remove: Whenever a character takes Damage, their Overarmor loses _Durability_ equal to half the Damage taken. If targeted by its Weakness, it takes an additional 2 Damage, even if the character took no Damage.

name: Blind
desc: When a creature's eyesight is hindered, rendering them unable to effectively see.
effect: A Blind creature treats all other creatures as _Veiled_.
remove: Creatures are Blinded until they spend 2 _Grit_ at the end of their _Turn_, or the duration specified when inflicted has passed.

name: Damaged
effect: Damaged only applies to _Equipment_. A Damaged Weapon takes a -2 penalty to all Attack Rolls. If _Armor_ is Damaged, instead inflict _Shred_ 1.
remove: Only Techniques that explicitly remove Damaged remove Damaged. Otherwise, it can be removed outside of combat with [travel mechanic here].

name: Disarmed
effect: When a creature inflicts Disarmed the Target immediately loses a piece of Equipment they have _Wielded_ or _Equipped_. While Disarmed, a character may not _Wield_ or _Equip_ any new items.
remove: Only Techniques that explicitly remove Disarmed (such as Gather) remove Staggered. Otherwise, it is cleared at the end of combat.

name: Embed
effect: Embed effects are always paired with an Action that utilizes a Source or a Weapon. When Embed occurs, the Source or Weapon used in the Action is attached to or impaled in the Target and moves with it. If a Source is Embedded in a creature, they may be treated as that Source.
remove: A creature may _Sacrifice_ an Action to end Embed, or pay 2 _Grit_ at the end of a _Turn_ to end Embed, but take 4 _True_ Damage in the process.

name: Flying
effect: While Flying, a character ignores all Terrain and Obstacles that do not specifically target Flying characters. Melee Attacks have Disadvantage against Flying characters.
remove: Flying typically only lasts as long as a Technique or Stance provides, but is also ended early if the Target is knocked _Prone_.

name: Fragile
effect: Fragile decreases the Durability of a piece of Equipment or Obstacle by 2.
remove: Only Techniques that explicitly remove Fragile remove Fragile. Otherwise, it can be removed outside of combat with [travel mechanic here].

name: Grappled
effect:
A Grappled character's effect depends on if they are Top or Bottom.

The Top character has their Movement reduced by one tier and cannot use the hand utilized for Grappling for anything other than the Shove Technique or Strikes with an Unarmed Weapon.

The Bottom character is Stuck and, when the Top character moves, the Bottom character moves along with them.
If the Bottom successfully inflicts Grappled on the Top, they may either choose to end the Grapple or become the Top. If the Top inflicts Grappled on the Bottom, they may immediately instead inflict _Pull_ 6.
remove: At the end of their Turn, a Bottom character may expend Grit and Reflex to enter a Grapple Contest; if the Winner does not expend an equal amount of Grit or Momentum in any combination, the Bottom character is freed. The Bottom character is also freed if they or the Top are forcibly moved, such as by a Push or Pull. If the Top character is using both Hands for the Grapple treat their expended Grit and Momentum as 1 higher for the Grapple Contest.

name: Marked
desc: An effect caused when a creature is drawing all of a foe's attention.
effect: While Marked a creature treats their _Impaired_ Tokens as one higher (maximum 4) when attacking all creatures other than the one that Marked them. When attacking the creature that Marked them, they treat their _Impaired_ Tokens as one less (minimum 0).
special: If a creature that is already Marked is Marked again, simply treat the creature that inflicted the new Mark as the creature that Marked them. The Mark remains for whichever effect has the longer duration.
remove: Marked typically has a set duration. Additionally, a creature may end Marked by spending 2 _Momentum_ on a _Hit_+ on the creature that _Marked_ them.

name: Prone
desc: An effect caused when a foe is knocked flat on their back.
effect: A Prone creature cannot move. While Prone, melee attacks against the target gain Advantage, but ranged attacks have Disadvantage.
remove: A creature may downgrade their Movement by one tier to end Prone.

name: Restrained
desc: An effect cause when a creature's ability to move is severly hampered.
effect: A Restrained creature's ability to move is severely hampered. While Restrained, a creature cannot Move, makes all Attacks with Disadvantage, and all Attacks against them have Advantage.
remove: How to end Restrained is typically specified in the Technique that inflicts it. If nothing is specified, a creature may _Sacrifice_ an Action and spend 2 _Reflex_ to end Restrained.

name: Staggered
effect: When a creature inflicts Staggered the Target immediately loses one of their _Stances_ and replaces it with No Stance. While Staggered, a creature may not change their _Stance_.
remove: Only Techniques that explicitly remove Staggered (such as Gather) remove Staggered. Otherwise, it is cleared at the end of combat.

name: Stuck
desc: A status caused when a creature is unable to move, but their ability to fight is otherwise unimpaired.
effect: While Stuck a creature cannot take any Movement.
remove: How to end Stuck is typically specified in the Technique that inflicts it. If nothing is specified, a creature may spend 2 _Reflex_ at the end of their _Turn_ to end Stuck.

name: Sturdy
effect: Sturdy increases the Durability of a piece of Equipment or Obstacle by 2.
remove: Only Techniques that explicitly remove Sturdy remove Sturdy. Otherwise, it is removed at the end of combat, or when the _Technique_/_Stance_ that caused it specifies.
